instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: Hi, got this "Liquid Damaged" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in for repair. Has absolutely no corrosion though! Doubt it actually got wet at all. Regardless, it has no power, green light and then orange comes on. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> are present. S5 rails like <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> are not! Anyone know what could be wrong?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
Do you have original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger?
Post <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.

Can we know EXACT <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
Yup used a genuine 85w one and it was always used with a 60w genuine one according to the owner. 

<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.64V

Hope That helps!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: Update: Out of absolutely nowhere <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> collapsed to 1.8V. Left the board sitting with power for like 1 minute and now this.... <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR> shows a burn mark on it though im not sure if that's new... No more light on the charger. I didn't do anything to the board what so ever

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
Find why got burnt.
Post diode mode at <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR>/9.

BTW, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> must be high!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
".013 at <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR>"
Bad news...
Do a visual inspection first, on caps and ICs connected to 3V42.
If nothing strange, try injecting voltage.
Give time and pray to detect heat somewhere; do not go over 4V...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: Saw nothing unusual, injected 4V and got a draw of nearly 900mA. The SMC does get very hot, normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
Not at all normal.
Remove SMC abd check if diode mode goes high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
So removed the SMC! Was a bit hesitant to do this but it came off perfectly! And Diode Mode reading have changed... I now get:

<CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR> - .323
<CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> - .376


Better?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
Now looks good.
You must chabge SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: Hmm. I sadly have no donors on hand. Any idea where I can get decent replacements that are from actual boards and not just blank chips? Also, could this have caused the initial problems?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message:
"could this have caused the initial problems?"
No green light with shorted SMC possible...
Check for corrosion around <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>; pay atention to <CAPACITOR>C6994</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>/96.

"Any idea where I can get decent replacements"
I mentioned few times eBay seller galaxyelectronics2015 (Paul Lee) on the forum.
Write him directly, has many more scrap logic boards than listed on eBay.
If you are in US, contact Rossmann store...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: Okay, will do. Shipping to Germany will be super expensive though... I?ll report back as soon as I have a replacement SMC on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: I bought 15 scrap boards last time; 25? shipping to Spain through DHL...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A green light no power s5 rails not present
threads.message: He sadly didn't have any ones for this model MacBook Pro. Found one on AliExpress for 45$ with an SMC though they only ship to the US for some reason
